meanings.definition: To allocate or distribute (resources, funds, etc.) in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to reallocate the crayons to different students.
meanings.sent2: The company had to reallocate its budget to focus on marketing.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reallocate the ingredients after realizing he was out of salt.
meanings.sent4: The captain had to reallocate the crew to different tasks during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The gardener had to reallocate the plants to ensure proper sunlight exposure.

meanings.definition: To assign or designate (something) to a different purpose or use.
meanings.sent1: She had to reallocate her time to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to reallocate the funds to support a new initiative.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to reallocate his props for the next trick.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to reallocate the paint colors to create a different effect.
meanings.sent5: The student had to reallocate study time to prepare for the upcoming exam.
